comments.body:
Not sure if this is the best way to refer to the module... what happens if we don't run nosetests form the right directory?  Maybe relative imports are what we want to use here (since the unittest code is python2.6+).
I think it's `from ... import swap_stdin_and_argv`)

I actually tried that first, but it gripes about relative imports in non-packages when I run the tests- damned if you do, damned if you don't... We're also doing this in a _bunch_ of places for DictDataLoader (not that that excuses it). I'd love to make the relative import work for all those- seemed like the right thing to do.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +24,28 @@import json

from units.mock.procenv import swap_stdin_and_argv

from ansible.compat.tests import unittest
